text: What was it?
is it possible to block countries from seeing anything from HubSpot (landing pages, forms, chat)?

You could serve up localized content for certain regions.  They’d still be able to navigate to the domain, but you could have a popup, or splash page or something letting them know the content isn’t available in their region
Thank you for your reply and help. I was hoping for an account level setting even with the domain. I also need to block chat and form embeds
Still a lot of “visit” on this page today. Still no idea where this come from <_<
in GA are you able to do the Hostname and Page as a secondary? i know they have that little jump link. Just curious if when you use that to go to the page, what page appears

im seeing the <http://preview.hs-sites.com|preview.hs-sites.com> in my GA View where I dont have hostnames filtered out. Just a quick question, how are you doing the GA script on the site? Are you just using the "Integrate with Google Analytics" field in the settings area: <https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/l/website/pages/all-domains/integrations>

it might come down to where HubSpot needs to put conditional logic in place that is the site is being loaded on the <http://preview.hs-sites.com|preview.hs-sites.com> domain that the GA Code is not shown as to not muddle with it.

Only other option is to use a hostname include filter in your GA to stop this traffic from showing in reports.

for this example and using your previous mentions, it would be this value in the filter pattern:
`^(www\.|pro\.)?(<http://chronogolf.com|chronogolf.com>)$`
You should then see traffic start to drop off of the realtime and then eventually disappear. This would also help with any other bot traffic or spam
Hi, anyone know if I can embed form of HubSpot in app of android or iOS?
if you’re app has a webview it can in the webview. otherwise you’ll likely want to use the Forms API to make it work in a native app
thankyou
Does anyone know if I can send contact information to the internal platform of my client, without exposing the information to third parties?
Thank you <@U2H3TT8F2>! I have another view with a filter like this already :slightly_smiling_face:
Yes, you can use the Contacts API

Anyone have any idea why a form button would be displaying with a weird gradient background color and large border-radius on iOS mobile browsers? It's an unstyled form and it displays with the correct solid background color on all desktop browsers. It displays correctly as a solid color in the chrome devtools emulator for iPhones and iPad. But on actual devices (tested 2 iPhones and an iPad), it shows weird in both mobile Safari and Chrome.
here's what the button looks like on desktop and Android mobile browsers, as I want it to
Here's how it looks on mobile iOS browsers
Chrome and IOS has default styling on buttons for some reason so you need to add -webkit-appearance: none; to your button styles.
ok great, thanks <@U39DT5YFL>
thanks
